Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Deploy target" (#2905) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
When adb fails it is difficult to understand thats going on especially from IDE where an user usually observes only error messages, something like: 
```
MyAndroidProject
   ...\Xamarin\Android\Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(3281,3): error MSB3073: 
The command ""C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-sdk\platform-tools\\adb" -s emulator-5554 install -r "bin\Debug\com.companyname.MyAndroidProject-Signed.apk"" exited with code 1.
```

It is better to have an error message like
```
MyAndroidProject
  ...\Xamarin\Android\Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(3285,9): error : 
The command ""C:\Program Files (x86)\Android\android-sdk\platform-tools\\adb" -s emulator-5554 install -r "bin\Debug\com.companyname.MyAndroidProject-Signed.apk"" exitied with code 1: 
adb: failed to install bin\Debug\com.companyname.MyAndroidProject-Signed.apk: Failure [INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_UNEXPECTED_EXCEPTION: Failed to parse /data/app/vmdl192544199.tmp/base.apk: AndroidManifest.xml]
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: No virtual method getInstanceId()Lcom/google/android/gms/tasks/Task; in class Lcom/google/firebase/iid/FirebaseInstanceId" (#2921) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Firebase package Xamarin.Firebase.Messaging 71.1502.0 - preview 1 (comes with additional related packages which are all in different versions)
2. Use getInstanceId() method from https://firebase.google.com/docs/reference/android/com/google/firebase/iid/FirebaseInstanceId
3. App crashes due to no NoSuchMethodError.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
getInstanceId() should be declared in FirebaseInstanceID

Also, I would expect Xamarin.Firebase packages would be available on the same version, and aligned with Xamarin.GooglePlayServices packages

### Actual Behavior
the method is not present in the Firebase.Iid.FirebaseInstanceID (71.1510.0 - preview 1) class in Xamarin, causing the crash

### Version Information

1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[netstandard] Remove; use Mono's version instead" (#2917) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/mono/mono/issues/11397

Stop building `netstandard.dll` within the xamarin-android build, and
instead use the `netstandard.dll` which is built by mono and included
in the mono archive (333b98b).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cannot drag more than one widget onto a RelativeLayout in Xamarin Android designer." (#5805) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
When editing an .xml layout in the Xamarin Android designer, it is not possible to drag more than one widget onto a RelativeLayout.


### Steps to Reproduce

1.Create a new Xamarin Android App project in Visual Studio.
2.Navigate to the "Resources/layout/activity_main.axml".
3.Try to add two buttons to the Design. Trying to add the second one will show the "not allowed" symbol in place of the cursor.

### Expected Behavior
we could drag more than one widget onto a RelativeLayout.
### Actual Behavior
it is not possible to drag more than one widget onto a RelativeLayout.
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:VS 2017 and VS 2019

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "XamlLoader should not ignore x:TypeArguments on root node" (#5804) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

`XamlLoader.Create()` does not resolve root type if it is a generic. Also, it provides the wrong type name to `FallbackTypeResolver` (it provides the base type name, rather than, for example, ``TypeName`1``). This is because it ignores the `x:TypeArguments` attribute when determining the type name.

### Issues Resolved ### 

- fixes https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/815082

### API Changes ###

None

### Platforms Affected ### 

- Core/XAML (all platforms)

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
Manually tested in previewer. Added test to `DesignTimeLoaderTests`.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has automated tests
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[CollectionView] ItemsLayout property types do not show in IntelliSense" (#5802) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Per [feedback](https://github.com/davidortinau/VisualChallenge/pull/9) from @mattleibow, the `ItemsLayout` property options for `CollectionView` does not appear in IntelliSense, making it difficult to discover.

>There was no IntelliSense for the `ItemsLayout` property, and had to clunk around and then realised it was a TYPE, not an enum. I had to revert to the docs just to understand how to use the list.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Attempt to set the `ItemsLayout` property CollectionView in a Xamarin.Forms project.
2. Note that options of `ListItemsLayout` or `GridItemsLayout` don't show up.

### Expected Behavior

The `ItemsLayout` options are easily discoverable.

### Actual Behavior

They are not easily discoverable.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0-pre8
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: VS2019
- Platform Target Frameworks: Any
- Android Support Library Version: N/A
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scrollviews scroll to fixed point when clicked" (#5779) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
We find that scrollviews often scroll to a fixed position when clicked/touched.

3.6.0.135200-pre1 and later are affected. 3.5.0.274416 are not.

This happens on UWP and iOS. Android untested.

Unfortunately we have not reduced this to a small repro yet.

Could anyone advise on what commits are in 3.6.0.135200-pre1 and not in 3.5.0.274416 so we can investigate?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Failed to execute 'which mono64': ExitStatus = 1" (#5791) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I can't run my Xamarin.iOS application.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Run the application from the IDE.

### Expected Behavior
Application starts on the iPad Mini connected to the Mac Mini that I connected to.

### Actual Behavior
Build hangs for a bit and then nothing happens.
Works fine on the Mac Mini in Visual Studio for Mac.
Since this appears to be a communication problem I figure this warning is relevant:
```
Xamarin.Messaging.targets(41, 3): [null] C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Professional\MSBuild\Xamarin\iOS\Xamarin.Messaging.targets(41,3): warning : Failed to execute 'which mono64': ExitStatus = 1
```

### Basic Information
- Version with issue: 3.4.0.1009999
- Last known good version: There's never been a good version
- IDE: Rider, Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS: 8.0.30703
- Nuget Packages:
  - Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Xamarin.Forms/100.2.1
  - Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Xamarin.iOS/100.2.1
  - Xamarin.Forms/3.4.0.1009999
- Affected Devices:
  - iPad Mini

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "XML fails to parse" (#5847) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

This is the XML that should be parsed:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE container PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<container xmlns="urn:oasis:names:tc:opendocument:xmlns:container" version="1.0">
  <rootfiles xmlns="urn:oasis:names:tc:opendocument:xmlns:container">
    <rootfile xmlns="urn:oasis:names:tc:opendocument:xmlns:container" full-path="OEBPS/html/9781509302369.opf" media-type="application/oebps-package+xml"/>
  </rootfiles>
</container>
```

It is parsed with the code as simple as:
```
                        using (var strReader = new StringReader(containerstring))
                        {
                            using (XmlReader reader = XmlReader.Create(strReader, getDefaultXmlReaderSettings()))
                            {
                                while (!reader.EOF && !reader.Name.Equals("rootfile", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase))
                                    reader.Read();

                                var success = true;
                            }
                        }
```

### Expected Behavior
This should work. The same code works on Windows UWP (Not Xamarin but native project).
### Actual Behavior
The exception is raised that there is a timeout while trying to get http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd
### Environment

<!--
1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
Visual Studio for Mac: Visual Studio > About Visual Studio > Show Details > Copy Information [button]
2. Paste into the code block below (between ```)
-->

```
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 
Version 15.9.9
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.9.9+28307.518
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03190

Installed Version: Community

Visual C++ 2017   00369-60000-00001-AA347
Microsoft Visual C++ 2017

Application Insights Tools for Visual Studio Package   8.14.20131.1
Application Insights Tools for Visual Studio

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Merge xcode10.2 into master" (#5846) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "Model attribute with Linker in SdksOnly and compilation Release to Device will cause Error MT0000 - System.NullReferenceException" (#5845) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the attached solution
2. Validate that compilation is configured to Release to Device **Important**
3. Validate that project TestApp is configured with Linker to SDKsOnly **Important**
4. Check bundle signing configuration
5. Rebuild the project TestApp

### Expected Behavior
Not throw a NullReferenceException 
### Actual Behavior
It produces an error:
```
MTOUCH : error MT0000: Unexpected error - Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com
    System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at Registrar.StaticRegistrar.GetBlockWrapperCreator (Registrar.Registrar+ObjCMethod obj_method, System.Int32 parameter) [0x0026e] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/StaticRegistrar.cs:4111 
      at Registrar.StaticRegistrar.Specialize (Registrar.AutoIndentStringBuilder sb, Registrar.Registrar+ObjCMethod method, System.Collections.Generic.List`1[T] exceptions) [0x0216b] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/StaticRegistrar.cs:3679 
      at Registrar.StaticRegistrar.Specialize (Registrar.AutoIndentStringBuilder sb) [0x00f3f] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/StaticRegistrar.cs:2959 
    MTOUCH : error MT0000: Unexpected error - Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com
    System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at Registrar.StaticRegistrar.GetBlockWrapperCreator (Registrar.Registrar+ObjCMethod obj_method, System.Int32 parameter) [0x0026e] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/StaticRegistrar.cs:4111 
      at Registrar.StaticRegistrar.Specialize (Registrar.AutoIndentStringBuilder sb, Registrar.Registrar+ObjCMethod method, System.Collections.Generic.List`1[T] exceptions) [0x0216b] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/StaticRegistrar.cs:3679 
      at Registrar.StaticRegistrar.Specialize (Registrar.AutoIndentStringBuilder sb) [0x00f3f] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/xamarin-macios/xamarin-macios/tools/common/StaticRegistrar.cs:2959 
Done building target "_CompileToNative" in project "TestApp.csproj" -- FAILED.
```

### Environment
<!--
1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
Visual Studio for Mac: Visual Studio > About Visual Studio > Show Details > Copy Information [button]
2. Paste into the code block below (between ```)
-->
It happens in two different Mac with different versions of Visual Studio For Mac, also from Visual Studio in Windwos connected to a Mac. 
Below is the information of one of the Mac:

```
